com.noctarius.borabora

Enum MajorType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<MajorType>
      • com.noctarius.borabora.MajorType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<MajorType>

    public enum MajorType
extends Enum<MajorType>
    The MajorType enum defines the basic types as specified by the CBOR specification (RFC 7049). Major types are directly encoded in the header, whereas ValueTypes can be a special case inside a given major type or a semantic tag tagged element.
    See Also:
    ValueType, ValueTypes

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ByteString
      ByteString describes an ASCII char only containing string.
      Dictionary
      Dictionary describes a value type representing a collection of key-value pairs.
      FloatingPointOrSimple
      FloatingPointOrSimple describes two distinct types of data.
      NegativeInteger
      NegativeInteger describes an always negative integer.
      SemanticTag
      SemanticTag describes a further specification of a following data item to flag the containing value as another ValueType, for example a string can be flagged as a datetime item.
      Sequence
      Sequence describes a value type representing a collection of values.
      TextString
      TextString describes an UTF-8 encoded char containing string.
      Unknown
      Unknown describes an unknown major type that be added to a later version of the CBOR specification or is returned whenever the type cannot be read for other, yet unknown, reasons.
      UnsignedInteger
      UnsignedInteger describes an unsigned integer with a bit-size of 1 to 64 bit.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • UnsignedInteger

        public static final MajorType UnsignedInteger
        UnsignedInteger describes an unsigned integer with a bit-size of 1 to 64 bit.

      • NegativeInteger

        public static final MajorType NegativeInteger
        NegativeInteger describes an always negative integer. This is not the commonly expected signed integer as it cannot take positive values. The bit-size is between 1 and 64 bit.

      • ByteString

        public static final MajorType ByteString
        ByteString describes an ASCII char only containing string. The length of a string is defined as an UnsignedInteger (up to 64 bit), however Java cannot represent string of that size.

      • TextString

        public static final MajorType TextString
        TextString describes an UTF-8 encoded char containing string. The length of a string is defined as an UnsignedInteger (up to 64 bit), however Java cannot represent string of that size.

      • Sequence

        public static final MajorType Sequence
        Sequence describes a value type representing a collection of values. Each element in a sequence can have a different value type, and sequences can have a fixed element count or represent an indefinite number of elements. In the latter case borabora does a quick pre-scan to find the number and offsets of the elements.

      • Dictionary

        public static final MajorType Dictionary
        Dictionary describes a value type representing a collection of key-value pairs. Each key and each value in a dictionary can have a different value types, and dictionaries can have a fixed pair count or represent an indefinite number of pairs. In the latter case borabora does a quick pre-scan to find the number and offsets of the pair-elements.

      • SemanticTag

        public static final MajorType SemanticTag
        SemanticTag describes a further specification of a following data item to flag the containing value as another ValueType, for example a string can be flagged as a datetime item.

        SemanticTags are defined using tag ids that are specified by the IANA and available in the IANA CBOR Tag Registry.

      • FloatingPointOrSimple

        public static final MajorType FloatingPointOrSimple
        FloatingPointOrSimple describes two distinct types of data. The first value is either a HalfPrecisionFloat, a Float or a Double in the Java world. Values can be positive or negative.

        The second type of data encoded in this major type are commonly used simple values like null, true and false.

        The corresponding ValueType will automatically take into account what is encoded in the actual data item.

      • Unknown

        public static final MajorType Unknown
        Unknown describes an unknown major type that be added to a later version of the CBOR specification or is returned whenever the type cannot be read for other, yet unknown, reasons.

      • values

        public static MajorType[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (MajorType c : MajorType.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static MajorType valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • typeId

        public short typeId()
        Returns the type id, the CBOR specified id, for this MajorType.
        Returns:
        the type id

      • indefinite

        public boolean indefinite()
        Returns if this MajorType can be of indefinite size or not.
        Returns:
        true if indefinite size is possible, otherwise false

      • match

        public boolean match(short head)
        Matches a given header byte (represented as a short) against this MajorType.
        Parameters:
        head - the header byte to match
        Returns:
        true if the header represents this MajorType, otherwise false

      • findMajorType

        public static MajorType findMajorType(short head)
        Returns the MajorType according to the given header byte (represented as a short).
        Parameters:
        head - the header byte to match
        Returns:
        the MajorType matching the given header byte
